page.title: 08STRATHNAVER MUSEUM
page.content: The exhibits have all been collected locally, and more and more interesting exhibits are always gratefully received. {Items on Display} 1. Poster display prepared by local school children, illustrating the story of the Highland Clearances. 2. Reconstruction of a pre-Clearance house kitchen. 3. Showcases containing fragments excavated from houses in Rossal, one of the largest villages in Strathnaver and cleared in 1814. 4. Rare books in both English and Gaelic. 5. A Privy Council Warrant of Arrest dated 1621. 6. A portrait of Patrick Sellar. 7. A letter written by Rev. Donald Sage in 1821. 8. A prehistoric "Beaker" pot from 1900 BC. 9. A Clan Mackay Room.
